intro: Drosanthemum parvifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically blooming in winter. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant in rock gardens. Drosanthemum parvifolium is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
